intro: Seseli austriacum, commonly known as Austrian seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and compound leaves with a finely divided structure. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Seseli austriacum is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
